alert.note: Alert for Holmes (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Holmes County through 700 PM EDT... At 608 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Killbuck, or 10 miles south of Millersburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millersburg, Berlin, Walnut Creek, Killbuck, Holmesville, Glenmont, Winesburg, Farmerstown, Baltic, Mount Hope and Charm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
